Luckily, Samsung gets a lot of other things right on the S25 Ultra, which has a new Snapdragon 8 Elite processor, high-resolution ultrawide camera, and some sweet pro video tools that rival the iPhone 16 Pro. Samsung wisely kept all the best parts of last year's Galaxy S24 Ultra (basically the entire phone including that antireflective display) but some of its worst parts, too, like the $1,300 price tag.If you want the best screen you can find on any phone, get the S25 Ultra. If you want the most versatile phone cameras, get the S25 Ultra. If you want a stylus, get the S25 Ultra. But if your needs scale back on any of those fronts, the more affordable S25 options, or even last year's S24 Ultra, may be worth considering. Read our full Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra review.Why we like itThe reason to get the Ultra over its S25 siblings is its screen, which is truly the best I've seen on any phone, and the cameras, which are a step above what the S25 and S25 Plus have. Added video features like ability to record in Log format gets the Ultra as close as it's ever been to the iPhone in terms of professional video capture.Who it's best forIf you have a Galaxy S22 Ultra or older, the S25 Ultra will seem like a significant upgrade. It's harder to make that case for S23 Ultra owners, who, unless their phone's battery is ailing or they can score an incredible discount, should otherwise sit this one out. And for you S24 Ultra owners, you don't need this phone. Save your money and treat yourself to a nice steak dinner and a movie.Who shouldn’t get itThe Galaxy S25 Ultra's appeal is muddied by its $1,300 price. The regular Galaxy S25 has the same functionality, power and longevity, and it costs $500 less. Want a bigger screen? Consider the Galaxy S25 Plus. It can take a rough sketch and turn it into artwork or help me have a conversation in French or Korean despite me only knowing a few words of either language. The new autofocus/auto zoom feature lets you prop the phone in a half-open position, the Z Flip 6 will automatically zoom in or out (switching between the main and ultrawide cameras) to get a photo that best suits the moment. But the AI features are the least impressive aspects of the the Z Flip 6.Samsung's latest clamshell style foldable has a new 50-megapixel main camera, a smaller hinge and crease, a larger battery and a Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 3. But all this comes at a higher starting price: $1,099 which makes it hard to appreciate the Galaxy Z Flip 6 for the absolute great phone that it is. Read our full review for the Samsung's Galaxy Z Flip 6.Why we like itSamsung's latest clamshell style foldable has a new 50-megapixel main camera, finally putting it on par with non-folding flagship phone cameras. The hinge is smaller and helps reduce the size of the crease on the internal screen. It has a new chip, the Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 3, and 12GB of RAM for flagship performance. There's even a larger battery. .nuxt-progress {
  position: fixed;
  top: 0px;
  left: 0px;
  right: 0px;
  height: 2px;
  width: 0%;
  opacity: 1;
  transition: width 0.1s, opacity 0.4s;
  background-color: #fff;
  z-index: 999999;
}
.nuxt-progress.nuxt-progress-notransition {
  transition: none;
}
.nuxt-progress-failed {
  background-color: red;
}

      Best Samsung Phone of 2025
    </h1> <!----> <div class="c-socialShareButton c-contentHeader_shareButton c-socialShareButton-bestList"><div><button aria-label="Share on Social Media" class="o-cnetButton-medium o-cnetButton-medium-iconOnly o-cnetButton-secondary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="c-globalSvgIcon c-socialShareButton_icon"><!----> <use xlink:href="#share"/></svg></button> <!----></div></div></div> <p class="u-speakableText-dek c-contentHeader_description g-outer-spacing-top-small">

    </p></div> <div data-cy="shortcodeFaq_answer" class="c-shortcodeFaqQuestion_answer" style="display:none;"><p>Phones are big in general with the smallest ones having a 6.1-inch screen and large models topping out at 6.8 inches. That makes visiting a store and trying a phone out before you buy it quite important.</p></div> <!----></div><div class="c-shortcodeFaqQuestion c-shortcodeFaq_question c-shortcodeFaqQuestion-leftRail"><div role="button" class="c-shortcodeFaqQuestion_header"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="c-globalSvgIcon c-shortcodeFaqQuestion_icon"><!----> <use xlink:href="#plus"/></svg> <svg aria-hidden="true" class="c-globalSvgIcon c-shortcodeFaqQuestion_icon" style="display:none;"><!----> <use xlink:href="#minus"/></svg> <p data-cy="shortcodeFaq_questionCollapse" class="c-shortcodeFaqQuestion_question g-text-bold">
      Cameras
    </p></div> <div data-cy="shortcodeFaq_answer" class="c-shortcodeFaqQuestion_answer" style="display:none;"><p>Phone cameras have gotten better over the past five years. Don’t be fooled by how many cameras a phone has; more is not necessarily better.</p></div> <!----></div><div class="c-shortcodeFaqQuestion c-shortcodeFaq_question c-shortcodeFaqQuestion-leftRail"><div role="button" class="c-shortcodeFaqQuestion_header"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="c-globalSvgIcon c-shortcodeFaqQuestion_icon"><!----> <use xlink:href="#plus"/></svg> <svg aria-hidden="true" class="c-globalSvgIcon c-shortcodeFaqQuestion_icon" style="display:none;"><!----> <use xlink:href="#minus"/></svg> <p data-cy="shortcodeFaq_questionCollapse" class="c-shortcodeFaqQuestion_question g-text-bold">
      Software support
    </p></div> <div data-cy="shortcodeFaq_answer" class="c-shortcodeFaqQuestion_answer" style="display:none;"><p>Phone makers promise varying lengths of long-term software and security support ranging from just one year to as many as seven. These updates not only ensure you get many of the latest features but also keep your phone secure.</p></div> <!----></div><div class="c-shortcodeFaqQuestion c-shortcodeFaq_question c-shortcodeFaqQuestion-leftRail"><div role="button" class="c-shortcodeFaqQuestion_header"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="c-globalSvgIcon c-shortcodeFaqQuestion_icon"><!----> <use xlink:href="#plus"/></svg> <svg aria-hidden="true" class="c-globalSvgIcon c-shortcodeFaqQuestion_icon" style="display:none;"><!----> <use xlink:href="#minus"/></svg> <p data-cy="shortcodeFaq_questionCollapse" class="c-shortcodeFaqQuestion_question g-text-bold">
      iOS or Android
    </p></div> <div data-cy="shortcodeFaq_answer" class="c-shortcodeFaqQuestion_answer" style="display:none;"><p>If your family and friends are on Apple services like iMessage and FaceTime, stick with an iPhone. If you’ve been deep on Samsung, stay on Android. The <a data-id="74d35707-ea30-470d-a917-60d3c5c17a78" href="https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/hands-on-galaxy-s25-and-s25-plus-are-more-of-the-same-with-ai-hogging-the-spotlight/" target="_self">Galaxy S25 and S25 Plus</a> tout solid performance, good cameras and long-lasting batteries. If you want a more versatile camera setup, consider the top-of-the-line <a data-id="74d35707-ea30-470d-a917-60d3c5c17a78" href="https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/my-first-48-hours-with-the-galaxy-s25-ultra-have-been-reality-bending/" target="_self">Galaxy S25 Ultra</a>. For a novel design, you can opt for Samsung's pricier <a data-id="74d35707-ea30-470d-a917-60d3c5c17a78" href="https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/best-foldable-phones/" target="_self">foldable phones</a>, the <a data-id="74d35707-ea30-470d-a917-60d3c5c17a78" href="https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/galaxy-z-flip-6-review-the-aha-moment-that-sold-me-until-i-saw-the-price/" target="_self">Galaxy Z Flip 6</a> and <a data-id="74d35707-ea30-470d-a917-60d3c5c17a78" href="https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/samsung-galaxy-z-fold-6-review-steps-forward-and-backward/" target="_self">Z Fold 6</a> -- or even its super slim <a target="_self" data-id="2b5c8923-868a-4f09-bdae-9488a1b0a7de" href="https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/i-was-wrong-about-the-galaxy-s25-edge-the-thin-phone-hype-might-be-legit/">Galaxy S25 Edge</a>. If you need a cheaper option, Samsung's <a data-id="74d35707-ea30-470d-a917-60d3c5c17a78" href="https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/samsung-galaxy-a15-5g-review-this-cheap-phone-is-a-stalwart/" target="_self">$200 Galaxy A15 5G</a> or <a data-id="74d35707-ea30-470d-a917-60d3c5c17a78" href="https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/i-got-a-look-at-samsungs-new-affordable-galaxy-a-phones-at-mwc-2025/" target="_self">Galaxy A26, A36 and A56</a>, which range from $300 to $500, might be a good fit. It has the same Snapdragon customized chip and RAM as the S25 Ultra, runs the same version of Android and costs $500 less.</p><p data-keep>The Galaxy S25 has a very capable triple rear camera setup that is versatile in capturing both bright outdoor scenes and candid moments inside under mixed lighting. You'll also have to spend $1,300 unless you score a trade-in deal.      </p><div data-ad-callout="Advertisement"><!----></div><p data-keep>Those who don't need the stylus, prefer more compact phone and still want a good camera should consider the Galaxy S25 or Galaxy S25 Plus.                   Best Samsung phone
                </h2> <div class="c-bestListListicle_header"><h3 class="c-bestListListicle_hed">
                    Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra
                  </h3></div> <!----></a> <!----></div></div></div> <div class="c-bestListListicle_details"><div class="c-bestListListicle_prosCons u-grid"><div class="c-bestListListicle_pros"><div class="u-flexbox-row u-flexbox-alignCenter g-outer-spacing-bottom-small"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="c-globalSvgIcon"><!----> <use xlink:href="#hero-check-outline"/></svg> <h4 class="c-bestListListicle_attribute g-text-bold">Pros</h4></div> <ul><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Best screen on any phone
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Versatile cameras
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Most powerful phone I've tested
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Good battery life
                </li></ul></div> <div class="c-bestListicle_cons"><div class="u-flexbox-row u-flexbox-alignCenter g-outer-spacing-bottom-small"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="c-globalSvgIcon"><!----> <use xlink:href="#hero-x-circle-outline"/></svg> <h4 class="c-bestListListicle_attribute g-text-bold">Cons</h4></div> <ul><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  $1,300 price
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Design is almost too minimal
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  AI features are hit-or-miss
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  S25/S25 Plus have similar features and cost less
                </li></ul></div></div> <div class="c-bestListListicle_descriptionContainer"><div class="c-bestListListicle_description c-bestListListicle_description-clamp"><p>Samsung's Galaxy S25 Ultra which has a lot of AI features, the best of which are interesting and the worst of which unreliable. Luckily, Samsung gets a lot of other things right on the S25 Ultra, which has a new Snapdragon 8 Elite processor, high-resolution ultrawide camera, and some sweet pro video tools that rival the iPhone 16 Pro. Samsung wisely kept all the best parts of last year's Galaxy S24 Ultra (basically the entire phone including that antireflective display) but some of its worst parts, too, like the $1,300 price tag.<br>If you want the best screen you can find on any phone, get the S25 Ultra. If you want the most versatile phone cameras, get the S25 Ultra. If you want a stylus, get the S25 Ultra. But if your needs scale back on any of those fronts, the more affordable S25 options, or even last year's S24 Ultra, may be worth considering. <a target="_self" data-id="3df08996-e0bf-46f0-a3f0-f1895f30e08d" href="https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/galaxy-s25-ultra-review-greatest-phone-screen-ever-and-lets-not-talk-about-the-ai/">Read our full Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra review</a>.</p><p><strong>Why we like it</strong></p><p>The reason to get the Ultra over its S25 siblings is its screen, which is truly the best I've seen on any phone, and the cameras, which are a step above what the S25 and S25 Plus have. Added video features like ability to record in Log format gets the Ultra as close as it's ever been to the iPhone in terms of professional video capture.</p><p><strong>Who it's best for</strong></p><p>If you have a Galaxy S22 Ultra or older, the S25 Ultra will seem like a significant upgrade. It's harder to make that case for S23 Ultra owners, who, unless their phone's battery is ailing or they can score an incredible discount, should otherwise sit this one out. And for you S24 Ultra owners, you don't need this phone. Save your money and treat yourself to a nice steak dinner and a movie.</p><p><strong>Who shouldn’t get it</strong></p><p>The Galaxy S25 Ultra's appeal is muddied by its $1,300 price. The regular Galaxy S25 has the same functionality, power and longevity, and it costs $500 less. Want a bigger screen? Consider the Galaxy S25 Plus. For the majority of people, the regular Galaxy S25 and S25 Plus will be a better fit.</p><p></p></div> <div class="c-bestListListicle_readMore"><div><span class="c-bestListListicle_readMore-ellipsis" style="display:;"> ...</span> <span class="c-bestListListicle_readMore-link">Show more</span> <svg aria-hidden="true" class="c-globalSvgIcon"><!----> <use xlink:href="#chevron"/></svg></div></div></div></div> <div data-cy="bestListListicle_cta" class="c-bestListButtons c-bestListListicle_buttonWrap"><div class="c-bestListButtons_ctaText o-cta">Get it now</div> <!----> <div data-location="BODY" class="c-shortcodeListicle_buttonContainer u-flexbox c-bestListButtons_link u-flexbox-wrap" data-v-66f96086><a href="https://assoc-redirect.amazon.com/g/r/https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0DP3GQ4QY?tag=cheapskate08-20&linkCode=ogi&th=1&psc=1" rel="noopener nofollow sponsored" target="_blank" title="(opens in a new window)" data-aps-asin="B0DP3GQ4QY" data-aps-asc-tag="cnet-buy-button-20" data-aps-asc-subtag="__COM_CLICK_ID__|-|dtp|cn" data-position="1" section="lead" data-cy="listicleBuyButton" class="c-shortcodeListicle_button c-commerceBuyButton o-cnetButton o-cnetButton-primary o-cnetButton-medium c-shortcodeListicle_button-bestList" data-v-66f96086><div data-v-66f96086>

xlink:href="#hero-check-badge"/></svg>
                  Best flip phone for Samsung
                </h2> <div class="c-bestListListicle_header"><h3 class="c-bestListListicle_hed">
                    Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 6
                  </h3></div> <!----></a> <!----></div></div></div> <div class="c-bestListListicle_details"><div class="c-bestListListicle_prosCons u-grid"><div class="c-bestListListicle_pros"><div class="u-flexbox-row u-flexbox-alignCenter g-outer-spacing-bottom-small"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="c-globalSvgIcon"><!----> <use xlink:href="#hero-check-outline"/></svg> <h4 class="c-bestListListicle_attribute g-text-bold">Pros</h4></div> <ul><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Matte finish
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  New main camera take good photos
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  7 years of OS updates
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Auto zoom for photos
                </li></ul></div> <div class="c-bestListicle_cons"><div class="u-flexbox-row u-flexbox-alignCenter g-outer-spacing-bottom-small"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="c-globalSvgIcon"><!----> <use xlink:href="#hero-x-circle-outline"/></svg> <h4 class="c-bestListListicle_attribute g-text-bold">Cons</h4></div> <ul><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  $1,100 starting price is high
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Cover screen is a step down in quality from the internal one
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Adding apps to cover screen is wonky
                </li></ul></div></div> <div class="c-bestListListicle_descriptionContainer"><div class="c-bestListListicle_description c-bestListListicle_description-clamp"><p>For better or worse, Samsung's Galaxy Z Flip 6 foldable is packed with AI. It can take a rough sketch and turn it into artwork or help me have a conversation in French or Korean despite me only knowing a few words of either language. The new autofocus/auto zoom feature lets you prop the phone in a half-open position, the Z Flip 6 will automatically zoom in or out (switching between the main and ultrawide cameras) to get a photo that best suits the moment. But the AI features are the least impressive aspects of the the Z Flip 6.</p><p>Samsung's latest clamshell style foldable has a new 50-megapixel main camera, a smaller hinge and crease, a larger battery and a Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 3. But all this comes at a higher starting price: $1,099 which makes it hard to appreciate the Galaxy Z Flip 6 for the absolute great phone that it is. <a target="_self" data-id="5e424539-6bee-48c8-9a2c-0566da763d31" href="https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/galaxy-z-flip-6-review-the-aha-moment-that-sold-me-until-i-saw-the-price/">Read our full review for the Samsung's Galaxy Z Flip 6</a>.</p><p><strong>Why we like it</strong></p><p>Samsung's latest clamshell style foldable has a new 50-megapixel main camera, finally putting it on par with non-folding flagship phone cameras. The hinge is smaller and helps reduce the size of the crease on the internal screen. It has a new chip, the Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 3, and 12GB of RAM for flagship performance. There's even a larger battery. For all intents and purposes, the new Z Flip 6 is a Galaxy S24 that can fold in half – which is fantastic.</p><p><strong>Who it's best for</strong></p><p>If you already have a Samsung phone and have been itching to try a flip phone, then then the Galaxy Z Flip 6 brings the software and features you're used to in a cutting-edge design that is equally nostalgic and seemingly futuristic.</p><p><strong>Who shouldn’t get it</strong></p><p>If you spend a ton of time around dirt or sand, this phone isn't for you.</p><p></p><p></p></div> <div class="c-bestListListicle_readMore"><div><span class="c-bestListListicle_readMore-ellipsis" style="display:;"> ...</span> <span class="c-bestListListicle_readMore-link">Show more</span> <svg aria-hidden="true" class="c-globalSvgIcon"><!----> <use xlink:href="#chevron"/></svg></div></div></div></div> <div data-cy="bestListListicle_cta" class="c-bestListButtons c-bestListListicle_buttonWrap"><div class="c-bestListButtons_ctaText o-cta">Get it now</div> <!----> <div data-location="BODY" class="c-shortcodeListicle_buttonContainer u-flexbox c-bestListButtons_link u-flexbox-wrap" data-v-66f96086><a href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0D192WWZ9/ref=twister_B0D8V53R83?tag=cnet-buy-button-20" rel="noopener nofollow sponsored" target="_blank" title="(opens in a new window)" data-aps-asin="B0D192WWZ9" data-aps-asc-tag="cnet-buy-button-20" data-aps-asc-subtag="__COM_CLICK_ID__|-|dtp|cn" data-position="2" section="lead" data-cy="listicleBuyButton" class="c-shortcodeListicle_button c-commerceBuyButton o-cnetButton o-cnetButton-primary o-cnetButton-medium c-shortcodeListicle_button-bestList" data-v-66f96086><!---->$1,100 at Amazon

<use xlink:href="#hero-check-badge"/></svg>
                  Best Samsung phone for most people
                </h2> <div class="c-bestListListicle_header"><h3 class="c-bestListListicle_hed">
                    Samsung Galaxy S25
                  </h3></div> <!----></a> <!----></div></div></div> <div class="c-bestListListicle_details"><div class="c-bestListListicle_prosCons u-grid"><div class="c-bestListListicle_pros"><div class="u-flexbox-row u-flexbox-alignCenter g-outer-spacing-bottom-small"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="c-globalSvgIcon"><!----> <use xlink:href="#hero-check-outline"/></svg> <h4 class="c-bestListListicle_attribute g-text-bold">Pros</h4></div> <ul><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Camera consistently delivers good images
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Impressive battery life
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  More AI features feel practical
                </li></ul></div> <div class="c-bestListicle_cons"><div class="u-flexbox-row u-flexbox-alignCenter g-outer-spacing-bottom-small"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="c-globalSvgIcon"><!----> <use xlink:href="#hero-x-circle-outline"/></svg> <h4 class="c-bestListListicle_attribute g-text-bold">Cons</h4></div> <ul><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Several gimmicky AI features
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Not many changes over the S24
                </li></ul></div></div> <div class="c-bestListListicle_descriptionContainer"><div class="c-bestListListicle_description c-bestListListicle_description-clamp"><p>The Galaxy S25's biggest flex that I noticed while testing is it shares many of the same attributes as its pricier counterparts, the S25 Plus and <a data-id="4cafbc3f-2080-4815-a450-6d5611431904" href="https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/galaxy-s25-ultra-review-greatest-phone-screen-ever-and-lets-not-talk-about-the-ai/" target="_self">S25 Ultra</a> – but it does so for several hundred dollars less. You'll find features like the AI Select tool, Audio Eraser and deeper Gemini integration across <em>all </em>of Samsung's S25 devices, as well as a custom <a data-id="4cafbc3f-2080-4815-a450-6d5611431904" href="https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/qualcomms-snapdragon-8-elite-chip-aims-to-level-up-ai-on-android-phones/" target="_self">Snapdragon 8 Elite</a> processor and 12GB RAM – making the smaller phone of the bunch still seem pretty mighty. </p><p><br>And while the Galaxy S25 might look incredibly similar to the <a data-id="4cafbc3f-2080-4815-a450-6d5611431904" href="https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/galaxy-s24-and-s24-plus-review-samsung-thank-you-for-prioritizing-battery-life/" target="_self">S24</a> and share many of the same specs, consistency isn't so bad when it means there's a consistently good camera and great battery life. <a target="_self" data-id="e787c610-72fb-44d9-9bb2-3d7fa4b6916d" href="https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/galaxy-s25-and-s25-plus-review-ai-thats-enjoyable-without-being-overwhelming/">Read our full Samsung Galaxy S25 review</a>.</p><p><strong>Why we like it</strong></p><p>Having a baseline phone, like the Galaxy S25, that delivers many of the same perks as more expensive models, is a huge plus in my book. And given the remarkable processing power, standout camera and seamless AI integration in the Galaxy S25 lineup, it's great that I can get all those premium features for $800.</p><p><br><strong>Who it's best for</strong></p><p>If you're someone who insists on buying a flagship device, the Galaxy S25 won't let you down. but if you have a device that's two years old or more, you might be enticed to tap into all the latest Galaxy AI and integrated Gemini features. Now, $800 isn't pocket change, and there are definitely <a data-id="e53721be-7bce-43ea-bf52-c7d3cc643174" href="https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/best-cheap-phone/" target="_self">other options</a> for those who want to be more budget conscious, but if you're willing to spend a bit more, the baseline S25 can be a great all-around choice.</p><p><strong>Who shouldn’t get it</strong></p><p>You probably don't need to upgrade if you're using last year's S24.</p><p></p></div> <div class="c-bestListListicle_readMore"><div><span class="c-bestListListicle_readMore-ellipsis" style="display:;"> ...</span> <span class="c-bestListListicle_readMore-link">Show more</span> <svg aria-hidden="true" class="c-globalSvgIcon"><!----> <use xlink:href="#chevron"/></svg></div></div></div></div> <div data-cy="bestListListicle_cta" class="c-bestListButtons c-bestListListicle_buttonWrap"><div class="c-bestListButtons_ctaText o-cta">Get it now</div> <!----> <div data-location="BODY" class="c-shortcodeListicle_buttonContainer u-flexbox c-bestListButtons_link u-flexbox-wrap" data-v-66f96086><a href="https://assoc-redirect.amazon.com/g/r/https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0DP3G51DN/ref=asc_df_B0DP3G51DN1750676400000?tag=cnet-ce-20&creative=395261&creativeASIN=B0DP3G51DN&linkCode=asn" rel="noopener nofollow sponsored" target="_blank" title="(opens in a new window)" data-aps-asin="B0DP3G51DN" data-aps-asc-tag="cnet-buy-button-20" data-aps-asc-subtag="__COM_CLICK_ID__|-|dtp|cn" data-position="3" section="lead" data-cy="listicleBuyButton" class="c-shortcodeListicle_button c-commerceBuyButton o-cnetButton o-cnetButton-primary o-cnetButton-medium c-shortcodeListicle_button-bestList" data-v-66f96086><div data-v-66f96086>

data-position="NaN" section="all"><h2 id="c916268e-eaa6-47d8-bade-1033196750af" data-id="c916268e-eaa6-47d8-bade-1033196750af" class="c-bestListListicle_subhed"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="c-globalSvgIcon"><!----> <use xlink:href="#hero-check-badge"/></svg>
                  Best ultracheap phone
                </h2> <div class="c-bestListListicle_header"><h3 class="c-bestListListicle_hed">
                    Samsung Galaxy A15 5G
                  </h3></div> <!----></a> <!----></div></div></div> <div class="c-bestListListicle_details"><div class="c-bestListListicle_prosCons u-grid"><div class="c-bestListListicle_pros"><div class="u-flexbox-row u-flexbox-alignCenter g-outer-spacing-bottom-small"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="c-globalSvgIcon"><!----> <use xlink:href="#hero-check-outline"/></svg> <h4 class="c-bestListListicle_attribute g-text-bold">Pros</h4></div> <ul><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Excellent software and security support
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  25-watt wired charging
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Eye-catching Light Blue color option
                </li></ul></div> <div class="c-bestListicle_cons"><div class="u-flexbox-row u-flexbox-alignCenter g-outer-spacing-bottom-small"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="c-globalSvgIcon"><!----> <use xlink:href="#hero-x-circle-outline"/></svg> <h4 class="c-bestListListicle_attribute g-text-bold">Cons</h4></div> <ul><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Slow performance
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Single audio speaker
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Mediocre photography
                </li></ul></div></div> <div class="c-bestListListicle_descriptionContainer"><div class="c-bestListListicle_description c-bestListListicle_description-clamp"><p><strong>Editor's Note:</strong> Samsung has also released the <a target="_self" data-id="0130a92d-1a0d-42ce-ad73-41e990f6a900" href="https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/samsung-galaxy-a16-comes-to-us-at-200-with-6-years-of-updates/">Galaxy A16</a>.</p><p>Samsung’s $200 Galaxy A15 5G is an easy choice for someone looking to buy a phone that will last for years. Samsung provides it with four years of software updates and five years of security support, which in this price range is unparalleled. Plus the phone supports 25W wired charging that in my testing was able to charge half of its big 5,000-mAh battery from empty in 30 minutes. I also like the eye-catching light blue option.</p><p>A $200 phone has to have some compromises. The Galaxy A15 5G feels sluggish compared to competing phones like Motorola’s $200 Moto G 5G, and as an entertainment machine falls short with its single audio speaker that is blocked by accident when you hold the phone sideways for games and video. Photography, which is typically a weak point on phones in this price range, is similarly mixed with decent photography in outdoor environments while struggling to photograph lowlight spaces. This makes the Galaxy A15 5G an easy choice for when you just need a phone that can handle the basics, but you may want to consider other options if you are looking for the best pocket YouTube player in this price range.</p></div> <div class="c-bestListListicle_readMore"><div><span class="c-bestListListicle_readMore-ellipsis" style="display:;"> ...</span> <span class="c-bestListListicle_readMore-link">Show more</span> <svg aria-hidden="true" class="c-globalSvgIcon"><!----> <use xlink:href="#chevron"/></svg></div></div></div></div> <div data-cy="bestListListicle_cta" class="c-bestListButtons c-bestListListicle_buttonWrap"><div class="c-bestListButtons_ctaText o-cta">Get it now</div> <!----> <div data-location="BODY" class="c-shortcodeListicle_buttonContainer u-flexbox c-bestListButtons_link u-flexbox-wrap" data-v-66f96086><a href="https://www.amazon.com/Samsung-SM-155M-DSN-Unlocked-International/dp/B0CV31FT2V/ref=sr_1_3?crid=2VHSLB1Y8S0QK&dib=eyJ2IjoiMSJ9.tBvVq36cIk0uv4PPN5KgX2H6kCx23L-25zQo3br5wNc2E8Xd5UZz9vLnm-0oTGoe09Teom_hu8pUpYbc9a2qAEL2y9JVPGzoTPNRJG3pVpHAKI5XNiG55b61OJWrayXvmaR_0QF8zFCwIn-2QP5PVn6G-8GFyivvK9Z0yAds7uJ-HwsaoauhHRUDetUixLPlxB17Ojq4eoWiqSXLt0V5zZYO3wtMpYtdFFW8fN0dXF8.LKHVvxJU58Xa8A9ZN-jPThcE0pXOTvow9n3R1e3C4Is&dib_tag=se&keywords=Samsung%2BGalaxy%2BA15&qid=1743712795&sprefix=%2Caps%2C363&sr=8-3&th=1&tag=cnet-buy-button-20" rel="noopener nofollow sponsored" target="_blank" title="(opens in a new window)" data-aps-asin="B0CV31FT2V" data-aps-asc-tag="cnet-buy-button-20" data-aps-asc-subtag="__COM_CLICK_ID__|-|dtp|cn" data-position="4" section="lead" data-cy="listicleBuyButton" class="c-shortcodeListicle_button c-commerceBuyButton o-cnetButton o-cnetButton-primary o-cnetButton-medium c-shortcodeListicle_button-bestList" data-v-66f96086><!---->$179 at Amazon

data-position="NaN" section="all"><h2 id="6ec547b6-d5e6-4fdc-8192-efcfba38a844" data-id="6ec547b6-d5e6-4fdc-8192-efcfba38a844" class="c-bestListListicle_subhed"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="c-globalSvgIcon"><!----> <use xlink:href="#hero-check-badge"/></svg>
                  Best S25 Ultra alternative
                </h2> <div class="c-bestListListicle_header"><h3 class="c-bestListListicle_hed">
                    Samsung Galaxy S25 Plus
                  </h3></div> <!----></a> <!----></div></div></div> <div class="c-bestListListicle_details"><div class="c-bestListListicle_prosCons u-grid"><div class="c-bestListListicle_pros"><div class="u-flexbox-row u-flexbox-alignCenter g-outer-spacing-bottom-small"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="c-globalSvgIcon"><!----> <use xlink:href="#hero-check-outline"/></svg> <h4 class="c-bestListListicle_attribute g-text-bold">Pros</h4></div> <ul><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Lightning fast charging
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Nice big screen
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  7 years of OS and security upgrades
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Great performance with games, movies and animations
                </li></ul></div> <div class="c-bestListicle_cons"><div class="u-flexbox-row u-flexbox-alignCenter g-outer-spacing-bottom-small"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="c-globalSvgIcon"><!----> <use xlink:href="#hero-x-circle-outline"/></svg> <h4 class="c-bestListListicle_attribute g-text-bold">Cons</h4></div> <ul><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Battery life is a day, similar to baseline S25
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Similar specs as the S25 at a higher price
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Rival phones at the same price have better cameras
                </li></ul></div></div> <div class="c-bestListListicle_descriptionContainer"><div class="c-bestListListicle_description c-bestListListicle_description-clamp"><p>If the baseline Galaxy S25 appeals to you but you'd rather have a bigger screen and higher battery capacity – without upgrading all the way to the Ultra – the S25 Plus may be the phone for you. The entire S25 lineup shares many features, from AI capabilities to processing power to memory, so the Plus may be a viable choice if you're looking for something right in the middle.</p><p>That said, the Plus' minimal upgrades over the baseline S25 may not justify the $200 price difference. But if a bigger phone just feels better to hold and you'd rather have a 4,900 mAh battery (over the S25's 4,000mAh one), then that $1,000 starting price might ultimately be worth every penny. <a target="_self" data-id="d2384c61-80e3-42a4-94d2-15e0771c3dee" href="https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/galaxy-s25-and-s25-plus-review-ai-thats-enjoyable-without-being-overwhelming/">Read CNET's full Samsung Galaxy S25 Plus review</a>.</p><p><strong>Why we like it</strong></p><p>While the baseline S25 checks all the key boxes, the S25 Plus can simply feel like a more comfortable device to use, especially if you're a fellow member of the bigger hands club. In addition to sharing many of the same features as the pricier S25 Ultra, the S25 Plus has a higher battery capacity than the baseline model -- though in CNET's tests, there weren't any major discrepancies in how the two batteries actually performed. Still, sometimes you just want to live a little larger, and this phone can be the perfect fit.</p><p><strong>Who it's best for</strong></p><p>If you like having a larger screen to watch movies or play games on, the S25 Plus can be a great choice. While the S25 Ultra might be a top pick for someone who wants both a bigger phone and the most premium features, the S25 Plus can be that goldilocks device that meets you right in the middle -- without you having to spend $1,300 on the Ultra.</p><p><strong>Who shouldn’t get it</strong></p><p>If you want the absolute best in terms of cameras, don't get the S25 Plus. For $1,000 phones like the Pixel 9 Pro or iPhone 16 Pro have better cameras. Or if you can afford to buy a $1,300 phone, check out the Galaxy S25 Ultra which has an amazing set of lenses</p><p></p></div> <div class="c-bestListListicle_readMore"><div><span class="c-bestListListicle_readMore-ellipsis" style="display:;"> ...</span> <span class="c-bestListListicle_readMore-link">Show more</span> <svg aria-hidden="true" class="c-globalSvgIcon"><!----> <use xlink:href="#chevron"/></svg></div></div></div></div> <div data-cy="bestListListicle_cta" class="c-bestListButtons c-bestListListicle_buttonWrap"><div class="c-bestListButtons_ctaText o-cta">Get it now</div> <!----> <div data-location="BODY" class="c-shortcodeListicle_buttonContainer u-flexbox c-bestListButtons_link u-flexbox-wrap" data-v-66f96086><a href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0DP3H5V8C?tag=cnet-buy-button-20" rel="noopener nofollow sponsored" target="_blank" title="(opens in a new window)" data-aps-asin="B0DP3H5V8C" data-aps-asc-tag="cnet-buy-button-20" data-aps-asc-subtag="__COM_CLICK_ID__|-|dtp|cn" data-position="5" section="lead" data-cy="listicleBuyButton" class="c-shortcodeListicle_button c-commerceBuyButton o-cnetButton o-cnetButton-primary o-cnetButton-medium c-shortcodeListicle_button-bestList" data-v-66f96086><!---->$1,000 at Amazon

                </h2> <div class="c-bestListListicle_header"><h3 class="c-bestListListicle_hed">
                    Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 6
                  </h3></div> <!----></a> <!----></div></div></div> <div class="c-bestListListicle_details"><div class="c-bestListListicle_prosCons u-grid"><div class="c-bestListListicle_pros"><div class="u-flexbox-row u-flexbox-alignCenter g-outer-spacing-bottom-small"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="c-globalSvgIcon"><!----> <use xlink:href="#hero-check-outline"/></svg> <h4 class="c-bestListListicle_attribute g-text-bold">Pros</h4></div> <ul><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Larger and more symmetrical front screen
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Improved design with less noticeable crease
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Inner screen is best on any foldable phone I've used
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Better ultrawide camera than previous Fold 5
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  7 years of software upgrades
                </li></ul></div> <div class="c-bestListicle_cons"><div class="u-flexbox-row u-flexbox-alignCenter g-outer-spacing-bottom-small"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="c-globalSvgIcon"><!----> <use xlink:href="#hero-x-circle-outline"/></svg> <h4 class="c-bestListListicle_attribute g-text-bold">Cons</h4></div> <ul><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  $100 more expensive than the Z Fold 5
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Mediocre charging speeds and battery life that mostly gets through a day
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  New software features don't add more benefit to the foldable design
                </li></ul></div></div> <div class="c-bestListListicle_descriptionContainer"><div class="c-bestListListicle_description c-bestListListicle_description-clamp"><p>With the <a target="_self" data-id="f5a68926-6bf3-4781-9141-41d2e0d54bb6" href="https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/samsung-galaxy-z-fold-6-review-steps-forward-and-backward/">Galaxy Z Fold 6</a>, Samsung is getting closer to its goal of making a device that doubles as a phone and a tablet without compromising too much in either direction. The Galaxy Z Fold 6 has an improved design with a sleeker look that’s easier to grip, a less noticeable crease, a new processor and an upgraded ultrawide camera.</p><p>But it’s really the Galaxy Z Fold 6’s big, bright and crisp internal screen that makes it the best choice for those who want a foldable phone for entertainment. However, be prepared to spend a pretty penny: The Galaxy Z Fold 6 starts at an eye-watering $1,900, making it $100 more expensive than last year’s Z Fold 5 was at launch. Read our <a target="_self" data-id="f5a68926-6bf3-4781-9141-41d2e0d54bb6" href="https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/samsung-galaxy-z-fold-6-review-steps-forward-and-backward/">Sasmung Galaxy Z Fold 6 in-depth review</a>.<br></p><p><strong>Why we like it</strong></p><p>With the Galaxy Z Fold 6, Samsung finally achieved its goal of making a foldable that can truly replicate the experience of a traditional phone while doubling as a sleek tablet. Roughly five years after the original Galaxy Fold's launch, Samsung's book-shaped device has gotten lighter, slimmer, more durable and natural to use as a phone; a seemingly mundane but necessary improvement.</p><p><strong>Who it's best for</strong></p><p>If you can get past the sticker shock, there's a lot to love about the Galaxy Z Fold 6. I just don't know how many people are willing to fork over $1,900 to experience it. Carriers and retailers still offer some discounts that knock down that high price, but those deals usually come with conditions like trading in an eligible device or opening a new line of service.</p><p><strong>Who shouldn’t get it</strong></p><p>Samsung also hasn't provided the two biggest things I'm looking for in tablet-style foldable phones: more affordable prices and innovative software that makes better use of their dual screens.</p><p></p></div> <div class="c-bestListListicle_readMore"><div><span class="c-bestListListicle_readMore-ellipsis" style="display:;"> ...</span> <span class="c-bestListListicle_readMore-link">Show more</span> <svg aria-hidden="true" class="c-globalSvgIcon"><!----> <use xlink:href="#chevron"/></svg></div></div></div></div> <div data-cy="bestListListicle_cta" class="c-bestListButtons c-bestListListicle_buttonWrap"><div class="c-bestListButtons_ctaText o-cta">Get it now</div> <!----> <div data-location="BODY" class="c-shortcodeListicle_buttonContainer u-flexbox c-bestListButtons_link u-flexbox-wrap" data-v-66f96086><a href="https://shop-links.co/link/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.samsung.com%2Fus%2Fsmartphones%2Fgalaxy-z-fold6%2Fbuy%2Fgalaxy-z-fold6-256gb-unlocked-sm-f956uakaxaa%2F&publisher_slug=cnet&article_name=__ARTICLE_NAME__&article_url=__ARTICLE_URL__&exclusive=1&u1=subid_value" rel="noopener nofollow sponsored" target="_blank" title="(opens in a new window)" data-position="6" section="lead" data-cy="listicleBuyButton" class="c-shortcodeListicle_button c-commerceBuyButton o-cnetButton o-cnetButton-primary o-cnetButton-medium c-shortcodeListicle_button-bestList" data-v-66f96086><!---->$1,900 at Samsung

                  </h3></div> <!----></a> <!----></div></div></div> <div class="c-bestListListicle_details"><div class="c-bestListListicle_prosCons u-grid"><div class="c-bestListListicle_pros"><div class="u-flexbox-row u-flexbox-alignCenter g-outer-spacing-bottom-small"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="c-globalSvgIcon"><!----> <use xlink:href="#hero-check-outline"/></svg> <h4 class="c-bestListListicle_attribute g-text-bold">Pros</h4></div> <ul><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Lightweight design
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  200-megapixel main camera
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Durable titanium frame and Gorilla Glass front and back
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Powerful Snapdragon 8 Elite processor
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  12GB of RAM
                </li></ul></div> <div class="c-bestListicle_cons"><div class="u-flexbox-row u-flexbox-alignCenter g-outer-spacing-bottom-small"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="c-globalSvgIcon"><!----> <use xlink:href="#hero-x-circle-outline"/></svg> <h4 class="c-bestListListicle_attribute g-text-bold">Cons</h4></div> <ul><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Mediocre battery life
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Only 25-watt wired charging
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Steep price tag
                </li><li class="c-bestListListicle_value">
                  Just two rear cameras
                </li></ul></div></div> <div class="c-bestListListicle_descriptionContainer"><div class="c-bestListListicle_description c-bestListListicle_description-clamp"><p>The Galaxy S25 Edge is a unique offering -- one that doesn't necessarily cater to most people's top priorities like longer battery life and an affordable price tag, and yet it still presents an alluring option with its slim frame and lightweight body. Thankfully, it doesn't scale back too much in the way of features and capabilities; it's got a powerful Snapdragon 8 Elite processor and the same 200-megapixel main camera you'll find on the top-of-the-line S25 Ultra (though there's no telephoto lens). </p><p>The main sacrifice is battery life, as the S25 Edge has a 3,900-mAh battery, the lowest amount across the S25 series. It also only supports 25-watt wired charging. But it still offers enough juice to get you through the day, even if you're a notoriously heavy phone user. Plus, using something so remarkably feather-light feels like such a breath of fresh air, you may not mind making some compromises. <a target="_self" data-id="f99c5f37-1951-42eb-b7b7-bd7802565f1e" href="https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/i-was-wrong-about-the-galaxy-s25-edge-the-thin-phone-hype-might-be-legit/">Read our full Galaxy S25 Edge review</a>.<br></p><p><strong>Why we like it</strong></p><p>The S25 Edge is surprisingly enjoyable to use and hold, given its lightweight design (it weighs 163 grams) and generous 6.7-inch screen. And despite its thinner frame, it feels surprisingly sturdy, thanks to its Gorilla Glass Ceramic 2 display and Victus 2 backing. That means it doesn't feel like it's going to snap in your pocket -- and you'll hardly even feel it in there.<br></p><p><strong>Who it's best for </strong></p><p>If you want a phone that feels light and can slip easily into your pocket, without compromising too much on functionality, the S25 Edge is a great option. Plus, if you're looking for a fresh form factor but aren't interested in venturing into foldables territory, this unique phone is a solid -- and more familiar-feeling -- choice. </p><p><strong><br>Who shouldn't get it </strong></p><p>If you're looking for something more budget-friendly, the S25 Edge might not appeal to you. Also, if battery life is your top priority, the S25 Edge leaves something to be desired, since it only lasts about 24 hours before needing a recharge.</p></div> <div class="c-bestListListicle_readMore"><div><span class="c-bestListListicle_readMore-ellipsis" style="display:;"> ...</span> <span class="c-bestListListicle_readMore-link">Show more</span> <svg aria-hidden="true" class="c-globalSvgIcon"><!----> <use xlink:href="#chevron"/></svg></div></div></div></div> <div data-cy="bestListListicle_cta" class="c-bestListButtons c-bestListListicle_buttonWrap"><div class="c-bestListButtons_ctaText o-cta">Get it now</div> <!----> <div data-location="BODY" class="c-shortcodeListicle_buttonContainer u-flexbox c-bestListButtons_link u-flexbox-wrap" data-v-66f96086><a href="https://shop-links.co/link/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.samsung.com%2Fus%2Fsmartphones%2Fgalaxy-s25-edge%2Fbuy%2Fgalaxy-s25-edge-256gb-unlocked-sku-sm-s937uzkaxaa&publisher_slug=cnet&article_name=__ARTICLE_NAME__&article_url=__ARTICLE_URL__&exclusive=1&u1=[subid_value]" rel="noopener nofollow sponsored" target="_blank" title="(opens in a new window)" data-position="7" section="lead" data-cy="listicleBuyButton" class="c-shortcodeListicle_button c-commerceBuyButton o-cnetButton o-cnetButton-primary o-cnetButton-medium c-shortcodeListicle_button-bestList" data-v-66f96086><div data-v-66f96086>

real-world scenarios focusing on its features, design, performance, cameras, battery life and overall value. We document our findings in an initial review that is periodically updated when there are new software updates or to compare against new phones from competitors like Apple, Samsung, Google and OnePlus.</p><h3 id="88a1ece3-d247-47df-80f2-aea090a8605d" data-ng-block="{" id":"san5zt52w1ooxgo","type":"heading"}">Photography</h3><p>Photography is a major focus for most phones these days, so we take pictures and videos of various subjects in a variety of settings and lighting levels. We try out any new camera modes such as 4K 120fps slow motion video that debuted with the iPhone 16 Pro and 16 Pro Max or AI reframe and focus on the Motorola Razr Plus (2024).</p><figure class="c-shortcodeImage u-clearfix c-shortcodeImage-large"><div class="c-shortcodeImage_imageContainer"><!----> <div class="c-cmsImage c-shortcodeImage_image"><picture class="c-cmsImage_image"><source media="(max-width: 767px)" srcset="https://www.cnet.com/a/img/resize/9ddcf727b0db42d017c57736d0d8dc391365197f/hub/2024/07/17/08bd83ae-8018-49ed-988a-427a331737a3/img-3157.jpg?auto=webp&width=768" alt="The Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 6"><source media="(max-width: 1023px)" srcset="https://www.cnet.com/a/img/resize/532e953fd7d79968df18276561844eaa0a5938f0/hub/2024/07/17/08bd83ae-8018-49ed-988a-427a331737a3/img-3157.jpg?auto=webp&width=1024" alt="The Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 6"><source media="(max-width: 1440px)" srcset="https://www.cnet.com/a/img/resize/88e233164bfb9c9b900ff6914d31c8bc9ee5d0fe/hub/2024/07/17/08bd83ae-8018-49ed-988a-427a331737a3/img-3157.jpg?auto=webp&width=1200" alt="The Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 6"> <img src alt="The Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 6" height="900" width="1200" loading="lazy"></picture></div> <!----> <!----></div> <figcaption><!----> <span class="c-shortcodeImage_credit g-inner-spacing-right-small g-outer-spacing-top-xsmall g-color-text-meta g-text-xxxsmall">Lisa Eadiccico/CNET</span></figcaption></figure><h3 id="16d57d9e-7d51-4b28-b386-8eea9fe46ce6" data-ng-block="{" id":"7yu2cc9eyftd6g3","type":"heading"}">Battery life</h3><p>Battery testing is conducted in a variety of ways. We assess how long a phone lasts during a typical day of use, and note how it performs during more focused sessions of video calls, media streaming and gaming. We also conduct a video playback test, which isn't always included in the initial review and is added later in an update.</p><h3 id="b7c52cd9-c68a-4799-9553-3e4d12ede810" data-ng-block="{" id":"qqmq97wyvxh6q50","type":"heading"}">Performance</h3><p>We perform processor-heavy tasks like editing photos, exporting videos and playing games. We evaluate whether a newer version of a particular phone includes enough features to make it worth upgrading from older models.</p><figure class="c-shortcodeImage u-clearfix c-shortcodeImage-large"><div class="c-shortcodeImage_imageContainer"><!----> <div class="c-cmsImage c-shortcodeImage_image"><picture class="c-cmsImage_image"><source media="(max-width: 767px)" srcset="https://www.cnet.com/a/img/resize/27944b53357bd1232970c9d1109353fe17571190/hub/2025/04/05/07521a29-5e5b-4abe-8411-6493e356ad07/screenshot-2025-04-05-at-1-21-27pm.jpg?auto=webp&width=768" alt="A chart showing the results of the 3DMark benchmark test"><source media="(max-width: 1023px)" srcset="https://www.cnet.com/a/img/resize/fa130fef71d337f9a841cfbc12b106a63498ed52/hub/2025/04/05/07521a29-5e5b-4abe-8411-6493e356ad07/screenshot-2025-04-05-at-1-21-27pm.jpg?auto=webp&width=1024" alt="A chart showing the results of the 3DMark benchmark test"><source media="(max-width: 1440px)" srcset="https://www.cnet.com/a/img/resize/be26981db1de6acc95c9e6fa4a9bb718d91b7c4f/hub/2025/04/05/07521a29-5e5b-4abe-8411-6493e356ad07/screenshot-2025-04-05-at-1-21-27pm.jpg?auto=webp&width=1200" alt="A chart showing the results of the 3DMark benchmark test"> <img src alt="A chart showing the results of the 3DMark benchmark test" height="675.1999999999999" width="1200" loading="lazy"></picture></div> <!----> <!----></div> <figcaption><!----> <span class="c-shortcodeImage_credit g-inner-spacing-right-small g-outer-spacing-top-xsmall g-color-text-meta g-text-xxxsmall">Jeffrey Hazelwood/CNET</span></figcaption></figure><p>We use benchmarking apps to measure the performance, alongside our own anecdotal experiences using the phone for our review. Of particular note are how graphics and animations look. Are they smooth? Or do they lag or stutter? We also look at how quickly the phone switches between horizontal and vertical orientations and how fast the camera app opens and is ready to take a photo.</p><p><strong>Read more:</strong> <a Read our full review of the <a target="_self" data-id="a38f73e5-2f09-4d1f-9810-c670c9fe3308" href="https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/samsung-galaxy-s24-fe-review-flagship-features-for-small-sacrifices/">Samsung Galaxy S24 FE</a>.</p></div></div> <!----></div></div></section><section><div data-cy="infoCard" class="c-infoCard g-outer-spacing-bottom-large c-infoCard-izeBestList izeBorder"><div data-cy="infoCardHeader" class="c-infoCard_header u-flexbox u-flexbox-justifyBetween u-flexbox-alignCenter g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><h2 id="b7c94b60-ebad-4775-a06c-46e6bc6a6999" data-id="b7c94b60-ebad-4775-a06c-46e6bc6a6999" class="c-infoCard_hed g-color-primary">Samsung phone FAQs</h2> <button aria-label="Toggle Samsung phone FAQs" class="c-bestListBaseButton c-infoCard_arrowContainer o-cnetButton-small o-cnetButton-small-iconOnly o-cnetButton-secondary ">
  
  <svg aria-hidden="true" class="c-globalSvgIcon"><!----> <use xlink:href="#hero-chevron-up"/></svg></button></div> <div><div data-cy="infoCardDek" class="c-infoCard_dek"><div class="c-ShortcodeContent c-ShortcodeContent-theme:default"><div id data-cy="shortcodeListicle" data-id="listicle-3dd6219c-ec38-4952-bb41-82fcb77caf0a" data-location="LIST" class="c-shortcodeListicle g-border-thin-light-top g-inner-spacing-bottom-medium g-inner-spacing-left-large g-inner-spacing-right-large c-shortcodeListicle-infoCard c-shortcodeListicle-bestListInfoCard"><!----> <div class="c-shortcodeListicle_text"><!----> <div class="c-shortcodeListicle_heading g-outer-spacing-top-large"><!----> <div class="u-flexbox"><div class="c-shortcodeListicle_heds u-flexbox-column u-flex-grow u-flexbox-justifyCenter"><!----> <!----> <h3 class="c-shortcodeListicle_hed g-text-medium g-outer-spacing-bottom-xsmall">Why buy a Samsung phone instead of other Android phones?</h3> <!----> <!----></div> <!----></div> <!----></div> <!----> <!----> <!----> <div class="c-shortcodeListicle_dek c-shortcodeListicleDek g-color-text-meta c-shortcodeListicleDek-bestListInfoCard"><div class="c-shortcodeListicleDek_clamp" style="--line-clamp:3;"><div class="c-ShortcodeContent c-ShortcodeContent-theme:default sm:u-col-2 md:u-col-6 lg:u-col-12"><p>The right phone for you depends on a variety of factors, such as your budget, your current phone and whether you own other mobile accessories from the same company, such as earbuds or smartwatches. Many people prefer to stick with phones from the same company because the experience is more consistent and there's less of a learning curve when switching to a new device.</p><p>The same holds true for Samsung; the company's One UI software (its customized version of Android) can be found across its phone lineup. Samsung's One UI 6 introduced a more customizable lock screen and the ability to answer a phone call through a text message instead of speaking.</p><p>Consistency aside, there are some benefits to choosing a Samsung phone over devices from other Android phone makers. Samsung usually excels when it comes to display quality and brightness, and it typically offers a lot of choices in terms of size and pricing. Samsung phones usually offer decent battery life -- especially midsize and large phones -- and the cameras are usually among the best, especially on the Galaxy S25 lineup. Samsung also offers seven years of Android version updates for most of its new smartphones, which is longer support than even Google provides for its Pixel phones.</p><p><a target="_self" data-id="67d9ca32-5e93-4a76-9936-694a8ef9c15b" href="https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/dont-drop-your-old-pixel-for-pixel-7-before-reading-our-comparison/">Google's Pixel devices</a> also have stellar cameras along with specific software features you can't get elsewhere. The <a target="_self" data-id="67d9ca32-5e93-4a76-9936-694a8ef9c15b" href="https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/oneplus-12-review-a-powerhouse-flagship-with-one-key-flaw/">OnePlus 13</a> is also cheaper than the Galaxy S24 Plus and Galaxy S24 Ultra at regular prices without a trade-in and offers faster charging speeds. It could be a better choice for those who want to pay a little less but still want a giant 6.82-inch screen and triple rear camera.</p></div></div> <!----> <a class="c-shortcodeListicleDek_readMore o-inText-link o-inText-link-lightBg">
      Show more
    </a></div></div> <!----> <div class="c-shortcodeListicle_buttonWrap"><!----> <div class="c-shortcodeListicle_commerceContainer"><!----> <!----> <div data-location="BODY" get-lead-tracking-data="function () { [native code] }" class="c-shortcodeListicle_buttonContainer u-flexbox" data-v-66f96086><!----></div> <!----></div></div></div><div id data-cy="shortcodeListicle" data-id="listicle-ce9ff9d3-c1b4-48aa-8da3-ac003f7b4635" data-location="LIST" class="c-shortcodeListicle g-border-thin-light-top g-inner-spacing-bottom-medium g-inner-spacing-left-large g-inner-spacing-right-large c-shortcodeListicle-infoCard c-shortcodeListicle-bestListInfoCard"><!----> <div class="c-shortcodeListicle_text"><!----> <div class="c-shortcodeListicle_heading g-outer-spacing-top-large"><!----> <div class="u-flexbox"><div class="c-shortcodeListicle_heds u-flexbox-column u-flex-grow u-flexbox-justifyCenter"><!----> <!----> <h3 class="c-shortcodeListicle_hed g-text-medium g-outer-spacing-bottom-xsmall">Which Samsung phone series is best, Galaxy A, S or Z?</h3> <!----> <!----></div> <!----></div> <!----></div> <!----> <!----> <!----> <div class="c-shortcodeListicle_dek c-shortcodeListicleDek g-color-text-meta c-shortcodeListicleDek-bestListInfoCard"><div class="c-shortcodeListicleDek_clamp" style="--line-clamp:3;"><div class="c-ShortcodeContent c-ShortcodeContent-theme:default sm:u-col-2 md:u-col-6 lg:u-col-12"><p>Samsung's Galaxy A and S families serve different purposes, so which one is right for you will depend on your needs and budget. The Galaxy A lineup is Samsung's mid-tier and budget line, and it's the best choice if you're looking for a <a target="_self" data-id="cc5903ef-5a5a-4019-83a9-5ec0ac2e66c0" href="https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/best-phones-under-500/">phone under $500</a> without a trade-in deal. These phones typically offer core features like a big screen, large battery and multiple cameras at a cheaper price. </p><p>You also get what you pay for; Samsung's cheapest phones have very limited storage space and poorer cameras compared with the pricier models, and they sometimes struggle with juggling multiple tasks. More expensive phones like the Galaxy A35 5G provide almost everything most people want in a basic phone, although you'll still have to compromise a bit on camera quality and general performance. </p><p>The Galaxy S series, on the other hand, is Samsung's flagship smartphone line. Galaxy S phones usually include the best tech that Samsung has to offer and features you'd expect on any high-end phone, such as a premium design, 5G support, screens with high refresh rates and multiple high-end cameras. The biggest updates that launched with the Galaxy S25 lineup, for example, included the bump to a 200-megapixel main camera on the Ultra and bigger batteries for the smaller models. You'll have to be willing to pay hundreds of dollars more than you would for a Galaxy A series phone in most cases. </p></div></div> <!----> <a class="c-shortcodeListicleDek_readMore o-inText-link o-inText-link-lightBg">
      Show more
    </a></div></div> <!----> <div class="c-shortcodeListicle_buttonWrap"><!----> <div class="c-shortcodeListicle_commerceContainer"><!----> <!----> <div data-location="BODY" get-lead-tracking-data="function () { [native code] }" class="c-shortcodeListicle_buttonContainer u-flexbox" data-v-66f96086><!----></div> <!----></div></div></div></div></div> <!----></div></div></section><div data-ad-callout="Advertisement" class="c-adDisplay_container c-pageArticle_adLeftRail_bottom c-adDisplay_container_mpu-bottom blank" style="min-height:250px;"><!----></div><section><div data-cy="infoCard" class="c-infoCard g-outer-spacing-bottom-large c-infoCard-izeBestList"><div data-cy="infoCardHeader" class="c-infoCard_header u-flexbox u-flexbox-justifyBetween u-flexbox-alignCenter g-outer-spacing-bottom-large c-infoCard_header-noToggle"><h2 id="96d77a08-8e81-4f9b-9768-21c5038437ce" data-id="96d77a08-8e81-4f9b-9768-21c5038437ce" class="c-infoCard_hed g-color-primary">What to look forward to in 2025</h2> <!----></div> <div><div data-cy="infoCardDek" class="c-infoCard_dek"><div class="c-ShortcodeContent c-ShortcodeContent-theme:default"><p>Samsung teased the Galaxy S25 Edge at its January Galaxy Unpacked event. For a novel design, you can opt for Samsung's pricier \u003Ca rel=\"follow\" data-id=\"74d35707-ea30-470d-a917-60d3c5c17a78\" href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.cnet.com\u002Ftech\u002Fmobile\u002Fbest-foldable-phones\u002F\"\u003Efoldable phones\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, the \u003Ca rel=\"follow\" data-id=\"74d35707-ea30-470d-a917-60d3c5c17a78\" href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.cnet.com\u002Ftech\u002Fmobile\u002Fgalaxy-z-flip-6-review-the-aha-moment-that-sold-me-until-i-saw-the-price\u002F\"\u003EGalaxy Z Flip 6\u003C\u002Fa\u003E and \u003Ca rel=\"follow\" data-id=\"74d35707-ea30-470d-a917-60d3c5c17a78\" href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.cnet.com\u002Ftech\u002Fmobile\u002Fsamsung-galaxy-z-fold-6-review-steps-forward-and-backward\u002F\"\u003EZ Fold 6\u003C\u002Fa\u003E -- or even its super slim \u003Ca target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow\" data-id=\"2b5c8923-868a-4f09-bdae-9488a1b0a7de\" href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.cnet.com\u002Ftech\u002Fmobile\u002Fi-was-wrong-about-the-galaxy-s25-edge-the-thin-phone-hype-might-be-legit\u002F\"\u003EGalaxy S25 Edge\u003C\u002Fa\u003E. Check out our roundup to find the phone that best fits your needs.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cshortcode shortcode=\"faq\" id=\"430fe06d-6a30-4fd5-810e-06fb0510f3ef\" heading=\"What to consider\" description=\"\" page-position=\"Left Rail\" can-collapse=\"true\" collapse-on-page-load=\"false\" can-truncate=\"true\" truncate-on-page-load=\"false\" questions=\"[{"question":"Size","answer":"\u003Cp\u003EPhones are big in general with the smallest ones having a 6.1-inch screen and large models topping out at 6.8 inches. That makes visiting a store and trying a phone out before you buy it quite important.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E","quickTake":"","canCollapse":"true","collapseOnPageLoad":"true","canTruncate":"true","truncateOnPageLoad":"false"},{"question":"Cameras","answer":"\u003Cp\u003EPhone cameras have gotten better over the past five years. Don’t be fooled by how many cameras a phone has; more is not necessarily better.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E","quickTake":"","canCollapse":"true","collapseOnPageLoad":"true","canTruncate":"true","truncateOnPageLoad":"false"},{"question":"Software support","answer":"\u003Cp\u003EPhone makers promise varying lengths of long-term software and security support ranging from just one year to as many as seven. These updates not only ensure you get many of the latest features but also keep your phone secure.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E","quickTake":"","canCollapse":"true","collapseOnPageLoad":"true","canTruncate":"true","truncateOnPageLoad":"false"},{"question":"iOS or Android","answer":"\u003Cp\u003EIf your family and friends are on Apple services like iMessage and FaceTime, stick with an iPhone. If you’ve been deep on Samsung, stay on Android. Know that switching between the two has never been easier.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E","quickTake":"","canCollapse":"true","collapseOnPageLoad":"true","canTruncate":"true","truncateOnPageLoad":"false"}]\" ng-block=\"{"id":"ag1gbz57r0fbgfz","type":"faq"}\" edition=\"us\"\u003E \u003C\u002Fshortcode\u003E\u003Ch2 id=\"ec29093e-c0c6-4780-aff9-4deaa6aa495b\" data-ng-block=\"{"id":"19bcbumi8kykk1s","type":"heading"}\"\u003E What is the best Samsung phone?   \u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\u003Cp\u003EThe Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra -- priced at $1,300 -- comes packed with maximum features which, for most people, is more than necessary. For the rest of us, the $800 Galaxy S25 is a standout among its Galaxy counterparts. It has the same Snapdragon customized chip and RAM as the S25 Ultra, runs the same version of Android and costs $500 less.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003EThe Galaxy S25 has a very capable triple rear camera setup that is versatile in capturing both bright outdoor scenes and candid moments inside under mixed lighting. Overall, the Galaxy S25 Ultra is ideal for Android fans who prioritize fast performance, versatile cameras and a spacious, bright screen.    \u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Ch2 id=\"f50e2490-c8a8-4f92-8d05-b7cb840949d0\" data-ng-block=\"{"id":"ogxnyrconj7lrbr","type":"heading"}\"\u003EHow to pick the right Samsung phone for you\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\u003Cp\u003EDeciding which Samsung phone is right for you comes down to what you want in a phone and how much you're willing to spend. If you want the largest screen available on a standard Samsung phone, enjoy note-taking with a stylus and need a camera with a significantly closer zoom, the Galaxy S25 Ultra is the right choice. You'll also have to spend $1,300 unless you score a trade-in deal.      \u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003EThose who don't need the stylus, prefer more compact phone and still want a good camera should consider the Galaxy S25 or Galaxy S25 Plus. If you just want the basics, like a spacious screen, 5G and a decent camera, consider the \u003Ca target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow\" data-id=\"eb78d828-d38a-4a61-a53b-f8449905fb03\" href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.cnet.com\u002Ftech\u002Fmobile\u002Fsamsung-galaxy-s24-fe-review-flagship-features-for-small-sacrifices\u002F\"\u003EGalaxy S24 FE\u003C\u002Fa\u003E. Those looking for the flashiest tech around -- and who also have deep pockets -- should consider the Galaxy Z Flip 6 or Z Fold 6. \u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003EFinding the best Samsung phone will ultimately come down to preference. Choosing among so many options can get complicated, so here's how to decide which Samsung phone is best for you. Refer to our \u003Cshortcode id=\"d7a763f6-b799-4009-9325-de03c914a81f\" uuid=\"d3b400a1-1485-45c9-a924-fbce412cca86\" label=\"Before Splurging on a New iPhone or Android Consider These Things\" asset-type=\"article\" slug=\"before-splurging-on-a-new-iphone-or-android-consider-these-things\" link-text=\"phone buying guide\" href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.cnet.com\u002Ftech\u002Fmobile\u002Fbefore-splurging-on-a-new-iphone-or-android-consider-these-things\u002F\" edition=\"us\" shortcode=\"link\" data-key=\"link_bulk_key\" api=\"{"id":"d3b400a1-1485-45c9-a924-fbce412cca86","slug":"need-a-new-iphone-or-android-phone-consider-these-things-before-you-buy","contentType":null,"edition":"us","topic":{"slug":"phones"},"metaData":{"typeTitle":"How to Buy","hubTopicPathString":"Tech^Mobile^Phones","reviewType":null},"section":"news"}\"\u003E \u003C\u002Fshortcode\u003E for more tips on how to choose the right device.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Ch2 id=\"e47da90e-dffd-410c-b16e-20052d59a171\" data-ng-block=\"{"id":"ud8bikxppk3g2ck","type":"heading"}\"\u003EBest Samsung phones in 2025\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\u003Cshortcode shortcode=\"cross_content_listicle\" content=\"X - LIST ITEM\" id=\"98cf14b7-4be6-4bb7-92de-d11dadaaf1aa\" hed=\"Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra\" superlative=\"Best Samsung phone\" description=\"\u003Cp\u003ESamsung's Galaxy S25 Ultra which has a lot of AI features, the best of which are interesting and the worst of which unreliable. Luckily, Samsung gets a lot of other things right on the S25 Ultra, which has a new Snapdragon 8 Elite processor, high-resolution ultrawide camera, and some sweet pro video tools that rival the iPhone 16 Pro. Samsung wisely kept all the best parts of last year's Galaxy S24 Ultra (basically the entire phone including that antireflective display) but some of its worst parts, too, like the $1,300 price tag.\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EIf you want the best screen you can find on any phone, get the S25 Ultra. If you want the most versatile phone cameras, get the S25 Ultra. If you want a stylus, get the S25 Ultra. But if your needs scale back on any of those fronts, the more affordable S25 options, or even last year's S24 Ultra, may be worth considering. \u003Ca target="_blank" rel="" data-id="3df08996-e0bf-46f0-a3f0-f1895f30e08d" href="https:\u002F\u002Fwww.cnet.com\u002Ftech\u002Fmobile\u002Fgalaxy-s25-ultra-review-greatest-phone-screen-ever-and-lets-not-talk-about-the-ai\u002F"\u003ERead our full Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra review\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWhy we like it\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003EThe reason to get the Ultra over its S25 siblings is its screen, which is truly the best I've seen on any phone, and the cameras, which are a step above what the S25 and S25 Plus have. Added video features like ability to record in Log format gets the Ultra as close as it's ever been to the iPhone in terms of professional video capture.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWho it's best for\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003EIf you have a Galaxy S22 Ultra or older, the S25 Ultra will seem like a significant upgrade. It's harder to make that case for S23 Ultra owners, who, unless their phone's battery is ailing or they can score an incredible discount, should otherwise sit this one out. And for you S24 Ultra owners, you don't need this phone. Save your money and treat yourself to a nice steak dinner and a movie.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWho shouldn’t get it\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003EThe Galaxy S25 Ultra's appeal is muddied by its $1,300 price. The regular Galaxy S25 has the same functionality, power and longevity, and it costs $500 less. Want a bigger screen? Consider the Galaxy S25 Plus. For the majority of people, the regular Galaxy S25 and S25 Plus will be a better fit.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\" page-position=\"\" tooltip-label=\"\" tooltip-value=\"\" \u003C\u002Fshortcode\u003E\u003Cshortcode shortcode=\"cross_content_listicle\" content=\"X - LIST ITEM\" id=\"5d1e1220-3fb3-45da-a60a-d230908b4f58\" hed=\"Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 6\" superlative=\"Best flip phone for Samsung\" description=\"\u003Cp\u003EFor better or worse, Samsung's Galaxy Z Flip 6 foldable is packed with AI. It can take a rough sketch and turn it into artwork or help me have a conversation in French or Korean despite me only knowing a few words of either language. The new autofocus\u002Fauto zoom feature lets you prop the phone in a half-open position, the Z Flip 6 will automatically zoom in or out (switching between the main and ultrawide cameras) to get a photo that best suits the moment. But the AI features are the least impressive aspects of the the Z Flip 6.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003ESamsung's latest clamshell style foldable has a new 50-megapixel main camera, a smaller hinge and crease, a larger battery and a Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 3. But all this comes at a higher starting price: $1,099 which makes it hard to appreciate the Galaxy Z Flip 6 for the absolute great phone that it is. \u003Ca target="_blank" rel="" data-id="5e424539-6bee-48c8-9a2c-0566da763d31" href="https:\u002F\u002Fwww.cnet.com\u002Ftech\u002Fmobile\u002Fgalaxy-z-flip-6-review-the-aha-moment-that-sold-me-until-i-saw-the-price\u002F"\u003ERead our full review for the Samsung's Galaxy Z Flip 6\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWhy we like it\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003ESamsung's latest clamshell style foldable has a new 50-megapixel main camera, finally putting it on par with non-folding flagship phone cameras. The hinge is smaller and helps reduce the size of the crease on the internal screen. It has a new chip, the Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 3, and 12GB of RAM for flagship performance. There's even a larger battery. For all intents and purposes, the new Z Flip 6 is a Galaxy S24 that can fold in half – which is fantastic.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWho it's best for\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003EIf you already have a Samsung phone and have been itching to try a flip phone, then then the Galaxy Z Flip 6 brings the software and features you're used to in a cutting-edge design that is equally nostalgic and seemingly futuristic.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWho shouldn’t get it\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003EIf you spend a ton of time around dirt or sand, this phone isn't for you.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\" page-position=\"\" tooltip-label=\"\" tooltip-value=\"\" product-score=\"[]\" linktext=\"\" linkurl=\"\" \u003C\u002Fshortcode\u003E\u003Cshortcode shortcode=\"cross_content_listicle\" content=\"X - LIST ITEM\" id=\"ec290931-dda6-4704-b960-1a6a282796c3\" hed=\"Samsung Galaxy S25\" superlative=\"Best Samsung phone for most people\" description=\"\u003Cp\u003EThe Galaxy S25's biggest flex that I noticed while testing is it shares many of the same attributes as its pricier counterparts, the S25 Plus and \u003Ca rel="" data-id="4cafbc3f-2080-4815-a450-6d5611431904" href="https:\u002F\u002Fwww.cnet.com\u002Ftech\u002Fmobile\u002Fgalaxy-s25-ultra-review-greatest-phone-screen-ever-and-lets-not-talk-about-the-ai\u002F"\u003ES25 Ultra\u003C\u002Fa\u003E – but it does so for several hundred dollars less. You'll find features like the AI Select tool, Audio Eraser and deeper Gemini integration across \u003Cem\u003Eall \u003C\u002Fem\u003Eof Samsung's S25 devices, as well as a custom \u003Ca rel="" data-id="4cafbc3f-2080-4815-a450-6d5611431904" href="https:\u002F\u002Fwww.cnet.com\u002Ftech\u002Fmobile\u002Fqualcomms-snapdragon-8-elite-chip-aims-to-level-up-ai-on-android-phones\u002F"\u003ESnapdragon 8 Elite\u003C\u002Fa\u003E processor and 12GB RAM – making the smaller phone of the bunch still seem pretty mighty.&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cbr\u003EAnd while the Galaxy S25 might look incredibly similar to the \u003Ca rel="" data-id="4cafbc3f-2080-4815-a450-6d5611431904" href="https:\u002F\u002Fwww.cnet.com\u002Ftech\u002Fmobile\u002Fgalaxy-s24-and-s24-plus-review-samsung-thank-you-for-prioritizing-battery-life\u002F"\u003ES24\u003C\u002Fa\u003E and share many of the same specs, consistency isn't so bad when it means there's a consistently good camera and great battery life. \u003Ca target="_blank" rel="" data-id="e787c610-72fb-44d9-9bb2-3d7fa4b6916d" href="https:\u002F\u002Fwww.cnet.com\u002Ftech\u002Fmobile\u002Fgalaxy-s25-and-s25-plus-review-ai-thats-enjoyable-without-being-overwhelming\u002F"\u003ERead our full Samsung Galaxy S25 review\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWhy we like it\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003EHaving a baseline phone, like the Galaxy S25, that delivers many of the same perks as more expensive models, is a huge plus in my book. And given the remarkable processing power, standout camera and seamless AI integration in the Galaxy S25 lineup, it's great that I can get all those premium features for $800.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWho it's best for\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003EIf you're someone who insists on buying a flagship device, the Galaxy S25 won't let you down. but if you have a device that's two years old or more, you might be enticed to tap into all the latest Galaxy AI and integrated Gemini features. Now, $800 isn't pocket change, and there are definitely \u003Ca rel="" data-id="e53721be-7bce-43ea-bf52-c7d3cc643174" href="https:\u002F\u002Fwww.cnet.com\u002Ftech\u002Fmobile\u002Fbest-cheap-phone\u002F"\u003Eother options\u003C\u002Fa\u003E for those who want to be more budget conscious, but if you're willing to spend a bit more, the baseline S25 can be a great all-around choice.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWho shouldn’t get it\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003EYou probably don't need to upgrade if you're using last year's S24.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\" page-position=\"\" tooltip-label=\"\" tooltip-value=\"\" product-score=\"[]\" ultracheap phone\" description=\"\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EEditor's Note:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E Samsung has also released the \u003Ca target="_blank" rel="" data-id="0130a92d-1a0d-42ce-ad73-41e990f6a900" href="https:\u002F\u002Fwww.cnet.com\u002Ftech\u002Fmobile\u002Fsamsung-galaxy-a16-comes-to-us-at-200-with-6-years-of-updates\u002F"\u003EGalaxy A16\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003ESamsung’s $200 Galaxy A15 5G is an easy choice for someone looking to buy a phone that will last for years. Samsung provides it with four years of software updates and five years of security support, which in this price range is unparalleled. Plus the phone supports 25W wired charging that in my testing was able to charge half of its big 5,000-mAh battery from empty in 30 minutes. I also like the eye-catching light blue option.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003EA $200 phone has to have some compromises. The Galaxy A15 5G feels sluggish compared to competing phones like Motorola’s $200 Moto G 5G, and as an entertainment machine falls short with its single audio speaker that is blocked by accident when you hold the phone sideways for games and video. Photography, which is typically a weak point on phones in this price range, is similarly mixed with decent photography in outdoor environments while struggling to photograph lowlight spaces. This makes the Galaxy A15 5G an easy choice for when you just need a phone that can handle the basics, but you may want to consider other options if you are looking for the best pocket YouTube player in this price range.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\" page-position=\"\" tooltip-label=\"\" tooltip-value=\"\" product-score=\"[]\" linktext=\"\" linkurl=\"\" like=\"~Excellent software and security support
